HR Coordinator offering well-rounded background in human resources, accounting and administration.
Skilled in preparing and analyzing staffing metrics and reporting.
Results-oriented Human Resources Executive with broad experience in all areas of HR, including policy development, performance management and benefits administration.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Payroll and HRIS Specialist

Location: Washington DC-Baltimore Area

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, General Business, Human Resources

Description:
Location: Reston, VA
Are you ready to elevate your career and transition your payroll experience into a rewarding Payroll and HRIS Specialist. Comstock, a pioneer in crafting sustainable, mixed-use communities, is excited to invite you to join our esteemed team. Renowned for our commitment to innovation, work/life balance, and comprehensive benefits, we offer a workplace that champions your professional growth. Nestled in a supportive and easily accessible location, our award-winning workplace is an ideal setting for your career aspirations. 
We're on the lookout for a dynamic individual who not only brings a strong payroll background but is also a stellar communicator, adept problem solver, and possesses adaptability and flexibility. Your role will be pivotal in enhancing the employee experience within our diverse and vibrant community. If you have minimal/no payroll experience, please do not pass up applying for this opportunity if you have significant transferrable skills from HRIS and/or analyst related roles. If you're enthusiastic about contributing to a forward-thinking organization that values your unique skills, apply now and be part of our journey to create extraordinary places for people to live, work, and play. Your next adventure awaits at Comstock! 
Key ResponsibilitiesPayrollOversee the complete payroll process using UKG for all employees.Generate crucial financial reports and reconcile payroll accounts monthly.Maintain meticulous records for new hires, terminations, and changes to employee details.Ensure compliance with all federal, state, and local payroll regulations.Provide responsive support for employee inquiries related to payroll.Benefits and Total RewardsAssist in the design implementation, and management of competitive benefit and compensation programs.Ensure seamless benefits administration including health, dental, vision, and retirement plans.Oversee benefits enrollment, changes, and COBRA administration, coordinating with payroll.Perform regular audits of benefits and payroll, ensuring compliance and accuracy.Spearhead our Wellness Program, creating events that promote employee health.
HR Operations and ComplianceSupport the Talent Acquisition team with candidate screening and hiring processes.Lead new hire orientations and manage the onboarding process.Direct our Rewards and Recognition Program, fostering a culture of appreciation.Drive the development and implementation of HR policies and procedures.Stay ahead of HR trends and legal requirements to ensure full compliance.
Skills, Knowledge and ExpertiseA minimum of 2-5 years of payroll processing and HR experience and deep knowledge, eager to transition into a broader HR role.Alternatively, if you have minimal/no payroll experience but have at least 1 year of HRIS (management, UAT, configuration, implementation, etc.) and/or analyst related experience, have intermediate excel experience (v-lookup, pivot tables, if/then statements), and have a learning mindset and exceptional critical thinking skills, we invite you to apply.BA/BS degree in Human Resources or a related field preferred.Proficient in HRIS and payroll systems, showcasing a strong aptitude for technology and data management.Experienced with UKGPro and semimonthly payroll, particularly with commissioned employees, is a notable advantage.Demonstrates a proactive ability to learn and grow, coupled with adaptability and flexibility in various HR functions.Possesses strong process management and detail orientation skills, ensuring accuracy and efficiency.Exhibits accountability and collaboration within the HR team, fostering a cohesive working environment.Strong interpersonal and communication skills to provide exceptional customer service to stakeholders, including senior team members, executives, and vendors.Exceptional problem-solving and critical thinking skills, enabling adept handling of complex HR-related inquiries.

Experience Level (if available): Associate
<JD_END>
